question: When is VAT registration compulsory?

question: What happens when a business submits a quarterly VAT return late?
answer: It incurs a penalty point.

question: What is the quarterly penalty threshold for late filing and what happens when it is reached?
answer: Four points and a £200 penalty is charged when this is reached. After this, late VAT returns also incur a £200 penalty.

question: When do penalty points expire?
answer: Normally after two years, but if threshold has been reached, a business has to submit four quarterly returns on time to reset points to zero.

question: What happens when VAT is paid late?
answer: - A fixed late payment penalty is charged (see tax tables) of VAT due × penalty percentage- Daily penalty (if > 30 days late) of VAT due × 4% × (n − 30) / 365- Late payment interest is charged from the due date until the VAT is paid of rate × overdue VAT × n/12 (or n/365 – read the Q).Late payment interest percentage is the assumed rate of late payment interest on the tax tables.

question: What errors can be corrected on the next VAT return?
answer: - < £10,000 error- 1% × net VAT turnover for return period (max £50,000)Full disclosure is required to reduce possible penalty.

question: What is the common penalty regime?
answer: Applies for failure to notify chargeability to, or liability to register for income tax, national insurance contributions (NICs), CGT, corporation tax and VAT.Penalties are behaviour related, based on the “potential lost revenue” (PLR):- Up to 30% of PLR if non-deliberate failure to notify- Up to 70% of PLR if deliberate failure to notify, increased to 100% if also concealmentPenalties can be reduced if taxpayer makes disclosure.

answer: Five years after the 31 January following the tax year where the taxpayer is in business (as a sole trader or partner or letting property).Note that this applies to all of the records, not only the business records; one year after the 31 January following the tax year otherwise.Maximum penalty £3,000 per tax year.

question: When is IHT on lifetime transfers due?
answer: If made between 6 April and 30 September, tax is due 30 April following the end of the tax year.Otherwise, six months from the end of the month of transfer.

question: When is IHT due on death tax on lifetime gifts?

question: When is IHT death tax on estate due?

question: When is corporation tax due for companies that are not large?

question: When is corporation tax due for large companies?
